title: @Ironstylus - Concerning Evelynn's TU/VU
body:
So I just spotted Evelynn's TU amongst the texture rebalances on the PBE.  Compared to all the other texture rebalances, Evelynn's got quite a bit of work, and it's clear hers is an actual proper TU.  And it looks good!  Definitely a vast improvement.  But it seems to raise a few issues.

If I recall correctly, you once said that Evelynn's rig is so bad that she outright *will not* get any new skins until she receives a much needed VU.
And if I'm not mistaken, TUs are generally reserved for champions who have old/outdated textures, but whose rig still holds up well.

Which leaves me wondering where Evelynn fits in.  I realize that, with the texture rebalances, a LOT of old champions are gonna have to be touched up to fit on new SR, but for all the others it's been mostly just colour tweaking. Doesn't giving Evelynn a more drastic texture update mean all that work is going to go to waste when she gets her inevitable visual update?  Is it that her rig not actually as bad as first assumed? Or is this a sign that her VU is still extremely, extremely far away? :( 
(I had been assuming/hoping she'd get it early-mid next year.)

replies.body:
Hey Gixia, 

I'm no IronStylus, but I can answer this question just as well!

The Texture Rebalances will not be impacting the work of the Champion Update team. They are being done as bandaids in order to make things look better on SRU, and look more cohesive with each other. These are different from Texture Updates which are more substantial in nature, as well as more long-term solutions to smaller problems. 

Evelynn still falls under the Rebalance camp here, even if the work is looking closer to an Update. We know that she needs a large amount of work, ala VU. She's on 'the list', and the Texture Rebalance does not affect her position on 'the list'.

Her rig is still terrible, her visuals still meh at best, but this is hopefully a good bandaid until the time she is (rightfully) updated.

OH CAN YOU?

..oh.. I guess you can.

I'm sure that it's still in the works, because there are still some problems present. No new skins for Eve, she's still got an odd design, and no lore to include her in any events to come. I just hope this isn't a huge setback for the VU since she looks a lot better than before.

Why make Masquerade Evelynn have more of a flesh tone instead of keeping her white? I liked it a whole lot more the way it was before :(

What I mean to say is I love the TU, just want her to stay pale white.

> Why make Masquerade Evelynn have more of a flesh tone instead of keeping her white? I liked it a whole lot more the way it was before :(
> 
> What I mean to say is I love the TU, just want her to stay pale white.

I agree with this wholeheartedly. Masquerade Evelynn still needs to be pale. It's part of the appeal of the skin. Changing it to flesh tone distorts the skin entirely.  It doesn't represent what players have purchased prior to this "band-aid" TU.

If the goal was to bring her skin more in line with traditional skin tones; then at the very least she could have been as pale as Jinx.

But I would rather Masquerade stay ghostly pale.

Any better? :D

http://i.imgur.com/uoN01rD.png
Honestly doesn't look all that different to me.  A little lighter yes, but still obviously flesh tone and not white the way the skin has always been.

I made two posts about this, so I'm glad that at least this thread is getting some attention. We understand that you want the skin to fit with the new map, but you're upsetting many eve players (and people that just like this skin) by giving her a regular human skin tone. While making her pale is an improvement, it isn't what we want for that skin, she needs to be 'white' or 'ghostly pale' as Izzabelle put it.
Better yes, but not white :(

That's an improvement, but I am still not sure why you've decided to go with human theme on this skin. I always thought it was regular Evelynn with silver body paint. And let's face it, Shadow Evelynn had human skin because there were no more obvious ideas for the recolor back in 2009 :)

> Any better? :D
> 
> http://i.imgur.com/uoN01rD.png

Yes. Thank you. 

{{champion:28}}
I wish you guys fixed Cassiopeia's colors this fast ...

I totally agree with this. There is "Shadow Evelynn" skin that represents her "human" form and Masquerade was always pale. I am a proud owner of that skin and I think this is outrageous. Riot, please keep her skin color the same in each skin accordingly!
Masquerade Evelynn's bandaid is the wrong color, and it's hurting her. Please don't leave her like this, she'll be sad.
I keep hearing that her delay in a VU is because there is no thematic direction you guys are settled on.  Is that still the case, or are you guys finally getting something together?

I am no Riot, but I am trying to start a conversation on that topic on the boards. Right now there's not much talking there, but hopefully we can get enough attention from Riot. Here's a link to my thread: 
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/1HQcmZvj-the-state-of-evelynn-overhaul-vu

Hi Ququroon,

I wanna ask you something.

When will Eve's VU be released? She looks old and terrible.
Please consider toning her skin color in the Masquerade skin to a more pale one. Here's how I think it should look. (old - pbe - my version)

Eve's work is not really a TU by definition, at least not in the levels of Sona, Skarner or Rammus. Believe it or not, all what eve got was a fresh coat of paint a tad more dedicated than the rest perhaps but all in all I'm guessing the work was done pretty fast in comparison.

Now, I think that yeah, these TRs will push most champions back, some more than others. Yes, eve model can be messy, but I think it's nowhere as messy as Taric's, Shaco's and Malphite's, her model has her almost naked so she's anatomically correct whereas Taric's has these old spikes all over the place and would greatly benefit from having more polygons, same for the other 2 who happen to be have distorted anatomy unlike Eve.

I believe though that after Riot takes care of most VUs they'll go through these TRs but for now they NEED to do this first in order for the 120 champions to fit on the new summoner's rift.

I disagree.  I feel it really is on the same level as Skarner/Rammus/Anivia.  Maybe not Sona, but Sona actually got some model updates to go with hers for her hair.  Evelynn gained a ton of extra detail all over her model.  It's also worth nothing she gained extra detail when all other texture rebalances have either removed detail, or simply been a straight palette swap.

http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Dm6EkZzbsss/VCRsS0-EFOI/AAAAAAAAZkQ/zOqXUu8qZAY/s1600/eve3.jpg

Like, that's a pretty huge addition of detail without updating the model.

But that's just a TU, why can't eve get a VU like Sion or Twitch? It's long over due for eve
Not to mention lore update

It is, and Ironstylus has stated in the past that she's pretty badly in need of a VU, and can't get new skins until she gets one.  That's kind of the whole reason I made this thread, to find out what's up. :P
Her boots need to be a little brighter, otherwise I like it.

Sigh, they keep ignoring her and just letting her pass..I really wish she got a VU and lore update.....
Riot just keep ignoring and ignoring

Dude. They have so much to do you can't say they're ignoring. Evelynn is clearly not ignored by Riot, they just need to find the time -- they have a certain amount of champions to update both visually and gameplay wise, they are updating the map, they are updating the client, they are updating the splash arts, and they need to CREATE more content all the time - as well as everything they do for teasers and reveals.

We know Eve is gonna have something coming for her. I'm pretty sure she's one of their priorities, too. They have been working on Sion for months now, and everything can't be done at the same time.
Overall this probably just means that Eves VU is still quite a bit away,I actually doubt that they'll give a Texture-rebalance to any champion who will be updated within the next months.
Yeah, that's what I figured sadly.  And while it's nice to have Rioters confirm she's still getting an update, they never actually denied that it is very far away still. :P
